tweets.content: It's healthy to have a nice rant once in a while. No shame in the rant. Embrace the channel. It's real.
tweets.author: AutismCapital

tweets.content:
Imagine what the world would look like if the power of psyop was used for good. If the powers that be that have monopolies on hypnosis, mind control, mesmerization, could move people towards being their best: loving, helping, winning, achieving, being strong, having family, etc. the world would look unimaginably different. If the global lens was focused on positive.

People don't realize that was one of the main goals of "religion," and let's not even call it that, let's call it "Project God." "Project God," was "Let's unite people around this one common impossible to reach standard, that's not tied to any one person, that can't be corrupted because it's not a real person, and let people strive to reach it." That's what created some of the best works of art, education, sanitation, societal advancement , everything we've seen. REAL progress. 

But today, like what happens with most things, that power is corrupted and used for bullshit, to sow division, clicks, engagement, ragebait, whatever, and invert good for nonsense. 

It would be incredible to see what humanity could do if we were all focused on one single point of focus. And have that point of focus be positive attributed that lead to GROWTH rather than decay: victory, achievement, valor, love, respect, glory, etc.

All the words that have been "inverted" to be "scary and mean," by people who do not know the first thing about building anything real in the world, let alone anything that endures and sustains.

TLDR: Focus is incredible. The more people who focus on one point, the more powerful the collective focus of everyone becomes. Imagine if the entire world focused on positive growth points of focus. What would humanity become?

tweets.content: Disclaimer: This is an egg sandwich positive account.
tweets.author: AutismCapital

tweets.content:
Egg Sandwiches costing $25 isn't inflation. What it is is that bodegas, delis, etc. know that people want an egg sandwich. When you want an egg sandwich, you'll pay for an egg sandwich. 

It's the same reason people will pay $30 for a small pizza. Comfort foods are luxury. There are people who pay $40 to DoorDash McDonald's instead of just getting a Steak. They want their burgers. 

The cost isn't about the cost of ingredients, or inflation, its about progressively greedy society charging what they know they can get away with. 

When you're an egg sandwich guy, you identify as an egg sandwich guy, and you'll pay for your egg sandwich to keep your identity intact instead of code switching to a steak man or a salad bro. 

That's how we get $25 egg sandwiches.

That's how they win.

tweets.content:
We read on this app once that someone devised a â€œbasedâ€ test to sus out who they could trust. 

Theyâ€™d be in conversation and then casually drop a â€œretardedâ€ and then observe the personâ€™s reaction. If there was none they knew they could keep speaking. 

Then theyâ€™d drop a â€œf**â€ and observe their reaction. If there was none, he knew he could talk business. 

Then for the final test heâ€™d drop a n-bomb. This was the real sink or swim moment. If there was no reaction he knew they could be friends. 

It was a pretty intuitive system and he swore it worked. He based funneled strangers into knowing what relationships he could have with them.

tweets.content:
Additionally adding:

- The ability to use the "post video" function from someone's original post and write text that is long enough to require the "show more..." button but keeping the video still embedded rather than it becoming just a link (with no video embedded)  once you pass the "show more" threshold
tweets.author: AutismCapital

tweets.content: Some potential improvements for Spaces:
tweets.author: AutismCapital

tweets.content:
Weâ€™ve been compiling a running list for potential improvements for X and wanted to share it here in case anyone has anything else theyâ€™d like to see: 

- The sorting by "top" for quote retweets doesn't work
- The sorting by "top" for likes doesn't remain at the latest setting. It always defaults back to recent. Would be nice to have it stay as top
- Scheduled posts on mobile
- The ability to edit replies to a post (within the time window)
- The ability to edit your original post after you've already replied to it with a follow up post (provided you're within the window)
- Disallow people from adding you to random groups in DMs
- Prevent random phantom messages spam (A notification that you have unread messages but there are none)
- The ability to have both polls/pictures in the same post
- A default â€œshow poll resultsâ€ option 
- There used to be an "add post" button on threads with two or more posts to easily create a thread. It's gone now. It was beneficial.
- A "satire" button for posts to avoid unnecessary community notes and allow people to make more clever and riskier posts while still communicating its satire to avoid confusion. A small box could appear next to the post sort of like the subscribers posts.
- An AI button for the same above reason.
- A â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€ button for when youâ€™re blocked that can send the user who blocked you a single ping as a way to request an unblock. 

Hopefully this more or less covers the major quality of use changes that could be made.

If thereâ€™s anything else youâ€™d like to see you can mention it here.

PSA: This account doesnâ€™t promote cryptos, memes, etc. When we post memes itâ€™s because theyâ€™re funny. People will often associate our posts of memes with the coins theyâ€™re trying to shill because thatâ€™s the crypto game, but weâ€™re not KOLs or involved. No matter what we post, people will try to associate a coin with it to promote their own bags, so if you see something claiming association, itâ€™s a lie and/or scam. Donâ€™t get duped. 

This is an entertainment account. Our goal is only to provide colorful and hopefully entertaining commentary and make you smile and/or laugh. Thatâ€™s what brings us joy. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
